events.event_name: Central Bank of Iceland February 2026 Meeting
events.description: The Monetary Policy Committee kept the key policy rate steady at 7.25%.

facts.fact_text: The Central Bank of Iceland kept its key policy rate at 7.25% in February 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Central Bank of Iceland’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept its key policy rate steady at 7.25% during its February 2026 meeting

facts.fact_text: The annual inflation rate in Iceland rose to 5.2% in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The annual inflation rate climbed to 5.2% in January 2026, from 4.5% in the previous month

facts.fact_text: The Central Bank of Iceland cut rates by 25 bps in November 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: following a 25 bps cut in November 2025.

claims.claim_text: GDP growth is expected to remain subdued.
claims.author: Central Bank of Iceland

evidences.evidence_text: GDP growth expected to remain subdued

claims.claim_text: Future rate cuts are dependent on inflation returning to the 2.5% target.
claims.author: Central Bank of Iceland

evidences.evidence_text: The Central Bank emphasized that any future rate cuts will hinge on clear evidence that inflation is returning toward its 2½% target.

claims.claim_text: Underlying inflationary pressures are continuing to persist despite a cooling labor market.
claims.author: Central Bank of Iceland

evidences.evidence_text: Despite slower economic activity and signs of a cooling labor market, underlying inflationary pressures continue to persist.

evidence.evidence_text: The Central Bank emphasized that any future rate cuts will hinge on clear evidence that inflation is returning toward its 2½% target.
Policymakers also noted that near-term monetary policy will continue to be guided by evolving trends in economic activity
